definition: destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about/displaced
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
surname Li
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
to lose/to miss/to fail
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: These towns already host hundreds of IDPs.
sentences.chinese: 這些城鎮現已收容了數百名國內流離失所者。

sentences.english: They were dusted out last winter.
sentences.chinese: 去年冬天他們由於塵暴而流離失所。

sentences.english: They are not  displaced, but they are poor.
sentences.chinese: 他們沒有流離失所，但是他們很窮。

sentences.english: The seeded answers quickly got displaced by write-ins.
sentences.chinese: 答案很快就在種子流離失所寫插件。

sentences.english: Sick and starving refugees are the flotsam and jetsam of war.
sentences.chinese: 生病和飢餓的難民是遭戰禍而流離失所的苦命人。

sentences.english: Yes, the government should help those who are displaced.
sentences.chinese: 是的，政府應該幫助那些流離失所的人。

sentences.english: No city is debating the displacement of residents more heatedly than Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 在芝加哥，關於流離失所的居民的爭論正在白熱化。

sentences.english: The remainder, referred to as displaced persons, or DPs, were people who literally had no place to go.
sentences.chinese: 其餘被稱爲流離失所的人是那些完全走投無路的難民。

sentences.english: Since World War II, the Middle East region has been plagued by incessant wars and conflicts. Numerous lives have been lost and many innocent people displaced.
sentences.chinese: 二戰以來，中東戰火不斷，生靈塗炭，百姓流離失所。

sentences.english: Separate mixing with variable displacement, volumetric pump.
sentences.chinese: 單獨的混合變流離失所，容積泵。

sentences.english: So were internally displaced and stateless people.
sentences.chinese: 在國內流離失所的人和無國籍的人士也是調查的對象。

sentences.english: About 212,000 people have been displaced by the conflict, the UN estimates.
sentences.chinese: 大約212，000人流離失所的衝突，聯合國估計。

sentences.english: The liquid is then displaced axially as the screws rotate and mesh.
sentences.chinese: 的液體，然後流離失所的軸向旋轉的螺絲和網格。

sentences.english: But, tracing these displaced groups is extremely difficult.
sentences.chinese: 然而，要追蹤這些流離失所的人羣極端困難。

sentences.english: After the outbreak of "8.13 War", refugees in shanghai were innumerable and couldn't go home.
sentences.chinese: 淞滬抗戰爆發後，上海無數難民流離失所。

sentences.english: "We were forced out of our hostel because of the World Cup, " Rossouw said.
sentences.chinese: “因爲世界盃我們流離失所，”羅索烏說。

definition: a remote and desolate place
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
homeless
desolate and uninhabited (idiom)
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
to disrupt/to throw into disorder
comfortable niche
lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
a family wrenched apart (idiom)
destitute/wretched poverty
to loot/looting
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
